page.title: 10THE COMMUNITY OF HORWICH (1)
page.content: Horwich could easily have become two separate communities after 1884. Instead the Locomotive Works brought many features of a thriving community life, clubs, facilities and even a fire station. Additional housing filled in the gap between the two roads of Horwich. However in the last forty years growth slackened, housing in the centre of Horwich deteriorated and yet new housing, some of it far too large for the average size of a modern nuclear family, was allowed to sprawl up the hillside towards Rivington Pike. Ugly "bombsites" started to appear in the town centre to the East of the "Crown", the landmark at the junction of the two main roads. Horwich would seem to have lost status when it was absorbed into Bolton Metropolitan Borough in 1976.
